intro: Bupleurum glumaceum var. euglumaceum, commonly known as the white bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
